Media Team Team Chrissy Wittmann Director of Winemaking, General Manager BIO × Chrissy Wittmann Chrissy Wittmann never intended to have a career in the wine industry. All she knew was that she wanted a life outside of her home town of Burbank, California, with its endless miles of concrete and urban sprawl. An avid participant in sports—softball, volleyball, basketball and some occasional skiing—Chrissy pursued a degree in Physical Education at California Polytechnic State University in San Luis Obispo. In her freshman year, Chrissy rekindled her love of nature during biology field trips and changed her major to Ecology and Systematic Biology. With her B.S. Ecology and Systematic Biology degree, Chrissy began work at an independent environmental chemistry lab analyzing soil and waste water samples. Her first peek into the wine industry came when she filled in for a vacationing co-worker in the lab’s wine division. “I didn’t completely understand what I was doing at first,” recalls Chrissy, “in part because, at the time, I was a beer and ‘7 & 7’ kind of gal.” But her interest was piqued, two years later, she became a Wine Chemist at Meridian. After two years with Meridian, she was promoted to Laboratory Enologist. Realizing she needed further education, Chrissy returned to Cal Poly, where she earned an M. S. in Agriculture with a concentration in Food Science. She wrote her thesis, a dissertation on seed color and extractable tannin in Syrah during ripening, while she worked as the Lab Manager and Production Winemaker at Courtside Cellars. In 2005, Advance degree in hand, Chrissy became the Assistant Winemaker at Scheid Vineyards, where she hit the ground running.  “That first year was a huge harvest, at least for me, with 12,000 tons of grapes coming into a brand new facility in which new systems were being tested for the first time ever,” she recalls. Chrissy rose to all the challenges. Chrissy was thrilled when the Wild Horse Winery & Vineyards Assistant Winemaker position was available essentially ‘in her backyard.’ “You couldn’t live in San Luis Obispo without knowing and loving Wild Horse,” she says. “And it could not have been more fortuitous, since my husband and I had just welcomed the birth of our first son six months earlier.” Just one year later, in 2008, Chrissy’s dream of becoming a winemaker was realized when she was promoted to the position of Winemaker; and in 2013 she was promoted to Director of Winemaking at Wild Horse Winery & Vineyards. “I couldn’t be happier.” Chrissy continues. “When I was younger, I hated the idea of spending my life sitting behind a desk all day. I wanted to be where things were happening. I wanted to have an opportunity to be outside and I wanted to be challenged every day.  And I’ve got all that here.” When not busy at the winery, Chrissy enjoys spending time with her husband and two sons. Their family time includes trips to Zion or Yosemite National Parks, multiple Bruce Springsteen concerts and San Francisco Giants’ baseball games. Nikki Mason Bazzo Account Executive, American Wine and Spirits BIO × Nikki Mason Bazzo Nikki Mason Bazzo, Account Executive, American Wine and Spirits Nikki Mason Bazzo is a California native who began her career with Southern Wine and Spirits in 2005 as an entry-level merchandiser.  She was soon promoted to a Sales Consultant role which then transitioned into trade-development, ambassador and portfolio management roles.  Today, Nikki is currently an Account Executive for the American Wine and Spirits division and is involved in numerous company wide initiatives such as “Women in Wine” and the “Emerging Leadership Program”.  She is always enthusiastic to undertake new projects and responsibilities that will further contribute to her personal and professional development while continuing to support company wide growth. Tina Boyle Beer, Wine & Spirits Buyer, Costco BIO × Tina Boyle Tia Boyle is the Los Angeles Regional Buyer for Costco Wholesale. She has buying responsibility for Beer, Wine and Spirits for 51 Southern California locations and 7 Hawaii locations. Employed with Costco for the past 27 years, she has spent the last ten years as Buyer for the liquor category responsible for over $500M in sales per year. Tina spent 6 years in operations early in her career at the Hawthorne & Laguna Niguel Costco locations learning the culture and business from the ground up. From 1988 to 1993 she held various positions throughout Costco, experiencing everything from pushing carts & membership to supervising front end sales. In 1994 she joined the buying group as an Inventory Control Specialist for liquor and was promoted to Assistant Buyer for Candy & Tobacco in 1999. By 2001 she was the Sundries Assistant Buyer and was then promoted to Candy & Tobacco Buyer in 2002.  In 2004 she took over as Foods and Dry Grocery Buyer before moving back to the liquor category as Buyer in 2005. Tina holds an Advanced Certification through the Wine & Spirits Education Trust. She has furthered her wine education by visiting many wine growing regions around the world studying and tasting wines to bring to Costco Members. Since 2008 she has been a Network of Executive Women committee member for Southern California and has been a supporter of the Christermon Foundation since 2005.  Her volunteer duties also include supporting The Children’s Miracle Network, Special Olympics, City of Hope and Compassion International. Tina and her husband Mike reside in Orange County, California with their two daughters Justine age 14 and Cameron age 7. Colleen Brennan Vice President, National Accounts On Premise, Rodney Strong Wine Estates BIO × Colleen Brennan Colleen Brennan is a wine industry professional recognized for her innovative sales and marketing achievements which span over 20 years in the beverage and restaurant industries. She is currently vice president of national accounts for Rodney Strong Wine Estates where she is responsible for business development, marketing, strategic planning, budgeting and sales for all on premise national account chains. Prior to joining Rodney Strong in 2012, she was director of global accounts and the on-premise marketing specialist at Ste. Michelle Wine Estates where she supervised sales to more than 30 restaurant chains. In this role, she increased sales by 65% over a six-year period and was recognized as the 2007 Salesperson of the Year for Antinori Italian wine brand. Brennan has also held executive level positions with leading restaurant companies including O’Charley’s and Cypress Companies. She served as director of beverage marketing at O’Charley’s, in charge of managing and growing beverage programs and profits for the restaurant chain’s 200 locations. Brennan’s consultative and creative approach to sales and marketing includes developing an innovative wine and spirits training tool for servers at O’Charley’s that dramatically increased product knowledge and beverage sales. She also created successful incentive contests that boosted sales and team member morale. One promotion resulted in over 200,000 incremental beverages sold during the first 10 weeks alone, representing a 200% increase in sales of one featured drink which became O’Charley’s top-selling beverage. Brennan’s creative strategies earned her a Cheers Beverage Excellence Award for best beverage promotion during this time. As director of restaurant marketing at Cypress Companies, owner of several chain concepts including Denny’s, Houlihan’s and An Tobar Irish Pub, she oversaw all marketing activities for 60 restaurants and pubs across five states. Brennan began her restaurant industry career at Pizzeria Uno Chicago Bar and Grill where she served as a field marketing manager for all corporate-owned locations in Florida. Brennan currently serves on the Board of Directors for The California Restaurant Association’s Education Foundation and is on the advisory board of Children of Restaurant Employees (C.O.R.E), a nonprofit organization that supports children of restaurant employees who have been afflicted with life-threatening conditions or affected by a significant life-altering circumstance. She has also served on several industry boards including the American Beverage Institute (Committee Chairperson), Cheer’s Magazine and the Millennium Group. Brennan holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Economics and Political Science from Yale University. Deborah Brenner Founder & President, Women of the Vine & Spirits BIO × Deborah Brenner Deborah Brenner, Founder & President, Women of the Vine & Spirits Deborah Brenner graduated from the University of Delaware with degrees in English and Journalism, and was soon hired by a television and film technology company that required international travel to countries for which wine is a part of everyday life. After over 20 years in the male-dominated field of high-end technology and owning a marketing and public relations firm, Ms. Brenner discovered during a fortuitous trip to Napa and Sonoma that many women in the wine industry - like in her own industry - are under-recognized. Compelled to tell their stories, she authored a bestselling collection of profiles on women in the wine industry, Women of the Vine: Inside the World of Women Who Make, Taste and Enjoy Wine, which Wine Spectator named a Critical Read of 2007. Through the process of writing the book and championing its subjects, Ms. Brenner became inspired to enter the wine business herself, releasing wine from a first-of-its-kind collective of seven artisan women winemakers from Napa, Sonoma and Paso Robles. For the following seven years, Ms. Brenner learned the business inside and out, but but eventually saw that producing wine wasn't the most effective way to support and advance women's careers in the wine industry. Shuttering the brand, she returned to the drawing board. After one year of thought, research, and long conversations, Brenner organized a first-of-its-kind event: the inaugural Women of the Vine Global Symposium. The conference, first held in March of 2015, existed to support, educate, and connect women working in the alcohol beverage industry; registration sold out quickly to 500 women from five countries. Given the overwhelming response, Brenner and the Women of the Vine Advisory Board went to work developing a consortium that supports professionals in the alcohol beverage industry year-round. Thus emerged the Women of the Vine Alliance, a membership-based organization, anchored by the annual Symposium, whose mission is to empower and equip women worldwide to advance their careers in the alcohol beverage industry, fostering gender diversity and talent development across the industry at large. Ms. Brenner has received a Rising Star Award from Women for WineSense (2008), a New York Small Business Administration Women in Business Champion Of The Year (2009), a New York City National Association of Women Business Owners Signature Award (2010), the Lillian Vernon Award for Outstanding Community Service by the Women's Enterprise Development Center (2011), a NY Women in Communications Rising Star Award (2013), and the Rockland Business Women's Network Woman of the Year Award (2014). She is also a member of Senator Gillibrand's NY Agriculture Working Group. She resides in Rockland County, New York. Karena Breslin Vice President, Digital Marketing, Constellation Brands Inc. As Vice President of Digital Marketing at Constellation Brands Inc., the world’s leading premium wine company, Karena manages digital strategy and execution for the company’s portfolio of 70  wine and spirits brands including: Robert Mondavi, Clos du Bois, Kim Crawford, and SVEDKA amongst others. Her organization is responsible for all social media and website initiatives as well as digital advertising and content marketing. She also leads marketing technology, including web and mobile applications as well as Constellation Brands’ enterprise community. Karena’s career in digital marketing and technology spans more than 16 years. She is a digital innovation and marketing leader with strategic and operational experience driving business growth for industry leading brands. Laure Colombo Winemaker, Vins Jean-Luc Colombo BIO × Laure Colombo Laure Colombo, Winemaker, Vins Jean-Luc Colombo (Rhone Valley, France) Only 30 years old and already a rising star of the Rhone Valley! Where does the fire and passion within her come from? When you meet Laure’s parents you understand that it is a typical trait of the Colombo family. Cornas is where she grew up. The vineyard was her playground. There she learned to love nature. She breathed in scents and aromas of all kinds, the very stuff that will bring any adult back to their childhood in a second. She first studied a master’s degree in business in Lille. Following graduation she worked for a few months in the USA (at Disney World for the Epcot Food & Wine Festival, at George Magazine and Wine & Spirit Magazine among others and as an aide-sommelier for Alain Ducasse at the Essex House). Her next step was to develop skills in marketing and communication with the prestigious Champagne houses of Dom Pérignon and Moët & Chandon and then with an Indian winery, Grover Vineyard, in New Delhi. She then returned to France, got a degree in viticulture in Bordeaux working part time at Château Haut Brion for one year, then followed up with a master’s degree in oenology in Montpellier and a few vintages on the Southern hemisphere. She became a winemaker and joined the family domain in 2010, now working as a viticulturist, oenologist, and brand ambassador all around the world. She’s also developing her own estate on Saint Péray’s heights. About Vins Jean-Luc Colombo Hailed as the winemaking wizard of the Rhône, founder Jean-Luc Colombo has achieved a high-profile international reputation for making innovative wines that are original, memorable and bursting with personality. Despite a resolute aversion to change in the Cornas region, Colombo has brazenly introduced innovative methods in his vineyards and throughout the production process based on a respect for nature and his fundamental belief that good wine is the culmination of three key elements: terroir, human endeavor and modern winemaking techniques. The result? A more accessible style of Rhône Valley wines, reflecting an exuberance of fruit and depth of expression and showcasing the full potential of the Syrah grape when grown in the unique terroir of Cornas. Through his intense dedication, Colombo has brought the wines of Cornas into the international limelight. The company now embraces wines representing major appellations of the Rhône Valley as well as the Languedoc and Roussillon regions of southern France. Colombo’s daughter, Laure, joined her father and mother as winemaker in 2010. The wines of Jean-Luc Colombo are imported to the US by Palm Bay International. Alison Crowe Winemaker,  Picket Fence, Garnet Vineyards BIO × Alison Crowe Alison Crowe is an award-winning winemaker, author and blogger based in Napa.  She is the Director of Winemaking for Plata Wine Partners as well as the Winemaker for Garnet Vineyards and Picket Fence Vineyards brands, among others.  Alison’s clients include acclaimed “Top 100” brands, nationally-distributed wineries, national retailers, celebrity chefs and hot start-up brands.   Her wines consistently earn high scores in national wine publications. Alison holds degrees in Viticulture & Enology and Spanish as well as an MBA from UC Davis.  She is on the boards of the Carneros Wine Alliance, The Unified Grape & Wine Symposium, and The Wine Industry Financial Symposium and is a frequent wine judge for international competitions.  She has penned the popular “Wine Wizard” column for Winemaker Magazine since 1998, writes for Wine Business Monthly and Wines & Vines Magazine and published The Winemaker’s Answer Book in 2007.  Her blog, GirlandtheGrape.com won “Best New Wine Blog” at the 2014 Wine Blog Awards. Kristen R. Decker President, Global Wine Company, Inc. BIO × Kristen R. Decker Kristen Decker is the President of Global Wine Company.  She joined the company in 2011 and has served as President and Director since that time.  Kristen is a driving force behind the growth of Global Wine Company within the wine club segment.  During her tenure, the company has expanded from three branded wine clubs (Williams-Sonoma Wine, The New York Times Wine Club and The Food & Wine Wine Club) to six (adding Mina Wine Club, The Washington Post Wine Club and More Uncorked) and launched its own Global Wine Cellars branded club.  Kristen believes the Global Wine Company wine clubs provide a superior wine club experience to their members, each uniquely designed to reflect the brands they represent and the customers they serve.  Previously, Kristen was the Controller of Peter Paul Wines, where she worked with the winemakers and within the distribution network in expanding the brand’s US presence, as well as overseeing all financial functions. Kristen came to the wine industry from the mortgage finance sector, where she is a founding member and the Chief Financial Officer of Headlands Asset Management.  Kristen manages all financial planning and analysis, reporting, tax and treasury functions for the company as well as legal, licensing and human resources. Kristen has more than 10 years in the wine industry, and over 25 years’ experience in finance, corporate strategic planning and oversight.  Kristen began her career in public accounting at KPMG Peat Marwick.  She received her MF from Indiana University’s Kelley School of Business, and her BA in Business Management from Sonoma State University Jennifer DePaola Vice President Human Resources & Chief Diversity Officer, Young’s Market Company BIO × Jennifer DePaola Jennifer DePaola, Vice President, Human Resources & Chief Diversity Officer, Young's Market Company Jennifer has over 20 years of Human Resources, Leadership Development, Talent Management, and Organizational Development experience. Jennifer is passionate about leadership development and has coached numerous managers and leaders to higher productivity and organizational responsibility. BIO × Barb Egenhofer Barbara (Barb) Egenhofer is a Human Resources and Organizational Development leader with depth and breadth experience in bringing a strategic business and integrated talent management approach to her work. She is currently Senior Vice President, Human Resources for the Wine and Spirits Division of Constellation Brands, a leading international producer and marketer of beer, wine and spirits with operations in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, New Zealand and Italy. Constellation is the number three beer company in the U.S. with high-end, iconic imported brands including Corona Extra, Corona Light, Modelo Especial, Negro Modelo and Pacifico.  Constellation is also the world’s leader in premium wine company with more than 7,600 employees, 100 brands in their portfolio, sales in over 100 countries, and operations in over 40 facilities.  Constellation’s brand portfolio includes Robert Mondavi, Clos Du Bois, Kim Crawford, Rex Goliath, Franciscan Estates, Mark West, Ruffino, Simi, Estancia, and Jackson-Triggs.  Te company’s premium spirits brands include, Black Velvet Canadian Whiskey, Casa Noble Tequila and SVEDKA Vodka. Gallo Winery BIO × Gina Gallo Gina Gallo: From Family Apprentice to Artisanal Winemaker The Gallo Signature Series is a collection of wines handcrafted by Gina Gallo, the acclaimed third-generation winemaker from one of America’s most historic winemaking families. In many ways, these wines are the culmination of Gina’s journey as a winemaker, from her days spent walking in the vineyards with her grandfather Julio, to her time in the cellar, honing her craft as an artisanal winemaker. A Winemaker’s Journey Gina’s journey as a winemaker began when she was just 10 years old, tending the gardens with her father and grandfather and picking fruits and vegetables that her mother and grandmother would turn into family meals.  One of eight brothers and sisters, Gina has fond memories of working alongside her family. She spent her high school summers working at the Gallo family’s winery, and she joined the Gallo sales team after earning her bachelor’s degree from Notre Dame de Namur University. It’s no surprise that Gina found her true calling as a winemaker, following in her grandfather’s footsteps. She studied winemaking at the University of California at Davis and later became an apprentice winemaker at the Gallo family’s experimental micro-winery in Modesto, CA. Under the tutelage of Julio Gallo and Marcello Monticelli, a 30-year veteran of the Gallo team, Gina flourished as a winemaker. Three years later, she completed her first full harvest in Sonoma County, working side by side with her brother, Matt.  He grew the grapes and she made the wine, in a partnership that has thrived for more than two decades. Understanding Premium Cigars What Makes a Cigar Premium? A premium cigar is handcrafted from the finest tobacco leaves, often aged for several years to develop complex flavors. Unlike machine-made cigars, premium options do not contain additives or artificial flavoring. Cigar Shapes and Sizes: Finding Your Style Cigars come in different shapes and sizes, impacting the smoking experience: Parejos (Straight-sided cigars) – Includes Robusto, Churchill, and Lonsdale. Figurados (Shaped cigars) – Includes Torpedo, Perfecto, and Pyramid. Aging and Storing Premium Cigars Proper storage is crucial to maintain quality. A humidor keeps cigars at an optimal humidity (65-72%) and temperature (65-70°F) , ensuring flavors remain intact. At our cigar shop in Florida, we take great care to store our cigars in the best possible conditions. Florida’s naturally high humidity levels often range between 60-80%, which is already within the ideal range for cigar preservation. Because of this, we do not use additional humidification in our store, as excess moisture can lead to over-humidified cigars, which may burn unevenly or develop mold. However, we always recommend storing cigars in a properly maintained humidor at home, as air conditioning and environmental changes can impact their condition. What Defines a High-End Wine? Best Wine Regions for Premium Selection Bordeaux (France) – Home to some of the world’s finest red blends. Napa Valley (USA) – Known for bold, high-quality Cabernet Sauvignon. Tuscany (Italy) – Famous for Sangiovese-based wines like Chianti and Brunello. Rioja (Spain) – Offers rich, oak-aged Tempranillo wines. Mendoza (Argentina) – A paradise for Malbec lovers. Tasting Techniques: How to Enjoy Cigars and Wines Together Cut and light the cigar properly to avoid bitterness. Sip wine slowly , allowing flavors to unfold. Pace yourself , alternating between cigar draws and wine sips. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) How long do premium cigars last? When stored properly, they can last decades without losing flavor.
